item.title: World stocks climb after Wall Street rallies on hopes for lower interest rates
item.description: Shares in Europe and Asia have advanced after U.S. stocks rallied again on hopes the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates

item.title: UK's Treasury chief set to raise taxes once again in her second budget
item.description: Britain's Labour government is set to deliver its second budget since returning to power in 2024

item.title: Bangkok court issues an arrest warrant for Thai co-owner of Miss Universe pageant
item.description: A court in Thailand has issued an arrest warrant for Jakkaphong “Anne” Jakrajutatip, a co-owner of the Miss Universe Organization, in connection with ...

item.title: As Russia pummels Ukraine’s energy systems, Kyiv hopes US gas will fill the gap
item.description: Ukraine's gas facilities have suffered severe damage from Russian drone and missile attacks, forcing the country to import more gas

item.title: China's pressure on Japan is a familiar tactic that could last for some time
item.description: China is turning to a well-used playbook to express its displeasure with Japan over a statement by its prime minister on Taiwan
